alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 03 at 12:52PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Maggie Creek Near Carlin affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. Jarbidge River Below Jarbidge affecting Elko County. Owyhee River near Mountain City affecting Elko County. .Warm daytime temperatures along with low temperatures remaining above freezing overnight will continue to accelerate snow melt. River flows continue to increase and could remain high for the next week. For the Maggie Creek...including Carlin...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Jarbidge River...including Jarbidge...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Owyhee River...including Wildhorse Dam, Wildhorse, Mountain City...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Owyhee River near Mountain City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flooding along the river channel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Wednesday, May 3 the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 7.5 feet Wednesday, May 3 and Thursday, May 4. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
